summary: This document contains the Articles of Incorporation for Financial Informatics, Inc., which later changed its name to Southern Trust Company, Inc. It outlines the corporation's purpose, structure, and the individuals involved in its formation, including their roles and responsibilities.

persons.name: Gregory R. Francis
persons.context: Gregory R. Francis certifies the incorporation of Financial Informatics, Inc. and its subsequent name change.

persons.name: Erika A. Kellerhals
persons.context: Erika A. Kellerhals is one of the incorporators of Financial Informatics, Inc.

persons.name: Gregory J. Ferguson
persons.context: Gregory J. Ferguson is one of the incorporators of Financial Informatics, Inc.

persons.name: Brett Geary
persons.context: Brett Geary is one of the incorporators of Financial Informatics, Inc.

persons.name: Gina Marie Bryan
persons.context: Gina Marie Bryan notarizes the acknowledgment of the incorporators.

events.title: Name Change of Corporation
events.description: Financial Informatics, Inc. changes its name to Southern Trust Company, Inc.

events.title: Incorporation of Financial Informatics, Inc.
events.description: Financial Informatics, Inc. is officially incorporated in the Virgin Islands.

locations: 9100 Havensight, Port of Sale, Suite 15-16, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, 00802
keyFacts: Financial Informatics, Inc. was incorporated on November 18, 2011.
The corporation changed its name to Southern Trust Company, Inc. on September 21, 2012.
The document includes the names of the incorporators: Erika A. Kellerhals, Gregory J. Ferguson, and Brett Geary.
Gregory R. Francis, as Lieutenant Governor, certifies the incorporation and name change.
Gina Marie Bryan notarizes the acknowledgment of the incorporators.
